Description: Fragment of foot of Attic pottery open vessel? Stand-ring glazed; black band at base of inside of foot. Outside glazed according to Register. Graffito sign on stand-ring.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The notion that this may be a Cypriot graffito is rejected by Masson ICS 354, n.2.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 864, pl. XXII, no. 864)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2047)
Masson 1983 / Les inscriptions chypriotes syllabiques. Recueil critique et commenté (, p. 354, n.2.)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5873 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
